name: Waste and recycling statistics
description: Information on waste generation and management

name: Brownfield land
description: Previously developed land that's no longer being used
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://www.gov.uk/guidance/brownfield-land-registers', 'link_text': 'Brownfield land registers guidance'}, {'link_url': 'https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/brownfield-land-registers-data-standard', 'link_text': 'Brownfield land registers data standard'}]

name: Advertisments
description: Areas where hoardings or similar are used for advertising

name: Parish
description: The smallest type of local government administrative area in England

name: Abandoned mines
description: Areas where mining has previously taken place but is no longer in use

name: Developer contributions
description: Financial or physical contributions from developers towards the cost of providing appropriate infrastructure and services to support their development

name: 5 year housing land supply (5yhls)
description: Data about sites where they are expected to come forward to build-out within the next five years

name: Local wildlife sites
description: Areas of land that are especially important for their local wildlife

name: Air quality index
description: Tool to show pollution levels in a particular site or region, through determining the concentration of Nitrogen Dioxide, Sulphur Dioxide, Ozone, Particles < 2.5µm (PM2.5), Particles < 10µm (PM10)

name: Cultural infrastructure
description: Places, spaces, and buildings where cultural activities take place.

name: Water quality
description: The condition of water, including chemical, physical, and biological characteristics

name: Water stressed areas
description: Areas where the demand for water exceeds the available amount

name: Wildbelt designations
description: Land currently of low biodiversity value that is designated for nature's recovery

name: BGS mineral resources
description: The geological distribution of all onshore mineral resources

name: Long established & protected woodland
description: Areas that have been wooded continuously from 1893

name: Site allocations
description: Areas identified as sites for housing, employment, retail or green space to be developed in the future
tags: housing supply and delivery;local plan;opportunity;policies map

name: Development plans and timetables
description: The status of emerging and current local plans and other development plans for local planning authorities
synonyms: Local plans;Development plan documents;Local development scheme

name: Internal drainage district
description: Areas that derive benefit or avoid danger as a result of drainage operations

name: BGS infiltration Sustainable Drainage Systems (SuDS)
description: An initial indication of the suitability of the ground for infiltration SuDS

name: Invasive non native species
description: Species which have been introduced into areas outside their natural range through human actions and are posing a threat to native wildlife

name: Lakes
description: Large areas of fresh water surrounded by land

name: Community halls
description: Community halls are available to the public for community-related recreational activities.

name: County council
description: Local government tier, often having the role of minerals and waste planning authority, highways authority and statutory consultee.

name: Open roads
description: High-level view of the road network, from motorways to country lanes

name: Non designated heritage asset
description: Buildings, monuments, sites, places, areas or landscapes (including Area of Special Local Character (ASLC)) identified by planmaking bodies as having a degree of heritage significance needing consideration in planning decisions, but which do not meet the criteria for designated heritage assets.

name: Green wedges
description: Green wedges - These areas of open land are designed to manage urban growth, maintain separation between settlements, and support environmental quality through the preservation of green infrastructure.

name: Building safety levy
description:
Developers will pay a Levy on new residential buildings which
require building control approval, unless exempt to ensure
fairness and mitigate supply impacts. The Levy will raise funds to pay for remediation of cladding on buildings,
where a developer cannot be held responsible or identified, and is a key
element of ensuring industry pays.

name: Land to be acquired for roadworks
description: Land reserved for roadworks

name: Sites of special scientific interest
description: A protected area that’s of particular interest to science due to rare species of fauna or flora or important geological or physiological features

name: Areas which would benefit from flood defences
description: Areas that would benefit from the presence of defences in a 1 percent fluvial / 0.5 percent tidal flood event.

name: Conservation areas
description: An area of special architectural or historic interest with a character or appearance that must be preserved or enhanced
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xXmcLRxSzEzLB9Z2H2ztsjh75ZtpSVz0V89R2j-hC1g/edit', 'link_text': 'Design process document'}, {'link_url': 'https://app.mural.co/t/mhclg2837/m/mhclg2837/1712065213311/0ddf4128ff318850d5965b157fb7ebd91e3c140a?sender=u1cae178c0a712eade24c2472', 'link_text': 'Conservation areas process map'}, {'link_url': 'https://www.gov.uk/guidance/conserving-and-enhancing-the-historic-environment', 'link_text': 'Historic environment guidance'}]

name: Distribution network operator (dno) licence area
description: There are 14 licensed Distribution Network Operators (DNOs) in Britain and each is responsible for a regional distribution services area. DNO Licence Areas are sometimes referred to as GSP Groups and historically have also been known as Public Electricity Supplier (PES) regions

name: Ancient and veteran trees
description: A tree that is of interest biologically, culturally or aesthetically because of its age, size or condition
blocked-reason: Data is available only under non-commercial licence

name: Libraries
description: A building containing collections of books and other media for use and borrowing by the public. Libraries increasingly have broader offerings, including child and youth provision, community services and health and wellbeing support.

name: National forest inventory
description: All forest and woodland area over 0.5 hectare with a minimum of 20% canopy cover, or the potential to achieve it
blocked-reason:
The available data doesn't have a persistent ID for us to use as the reference. This would make it harder to track any changes that are made to entities.

We should reach out to the Forestry Commission to see if they can add one.
[See github discussion for more details](https://design.planning.data.gov.uk/planning-consideration/air-quality-management-areas/screen/).

name: Mine entry
description: The entrances into a mine

name: Species data
description: Curated database of UK wildlife taxonomy

name: Local air quality action plan
description: Plan that outlines local action to improve air quality

name: Price paid data
description: Information on all property sales in England and Wales that are sold for value

name: Wildlife
description: Undomesticated animal species

name: National grid overhead lines
description: Electrical cables that transmit electricity across the country

name: Authorised landfill sites
description: Areas of land that are used to dump rubbish, either directly on the ground or filling in an unwanted hole

name: Borehole scans
description: Scanned images of the records of all onshore Great Britain (or near shore) boreholes, trial pits, shafts and wells

name: Religious grounds
description: Green space or greenspace is an area of undeveloped land in an urban context which is not usually available for development, such as playing fields, sports’ facilities, play areas and allotments.

name: Best and most versatile agricultural land
description: Land considered the most capable of growing crops for food and non-food uses

name: Historic landfill
description: Sites where there is no PPC (Pollution Prevention and Control) permit or waste management licence currently in force
blocked-reason: The identified single source dataset is currently blocked by the EA conditional licence, which is non-perpetual. To un-block this, we need to contact the EA to find a solution.

name: Bgs mining hazards (not including coal)
description: The potential for hazards due to underground (non-coal) mining

name: Other sports facilities
description: Courts and greens comprising natural or artificial surfaces, including tennis courts, bowling greens, athletics tracks and other outdoor sports areas

name: Playing fields
description: Land in the open air provided for physical education or recreation

name: Coal authority managed tips
description: Disused colliery tip sites owned and managed by the Coal Authority

name: Bldgs (buildings)
description: Tall buildings over 50m

name: Britpits mines & quarries
description: BritPits (an abbreviation of British Pits), include both surface and underground mineral workings, such as mines, quarries, oil wells, gas wells, ash and desulphogypsum plants.

name: Green corridors
description: Areas that create habitat connections and active travel routes through encouraging exercise and healthy living while linking fragmented sites of biodiversity

name: Central government buildings
description: Buildings that the UK central government owns or occupies

name: Clinics
description: Buildings which people can go to for medical care or advice

name: Local heritage assets
description: Assets designated by local authorities which are of local significance and require protection
synonyms: Non designated and locally listed historic assets;Locally listed areas

name: Major roads
description: Motorways and all class 'A' roads

name: Archaeological remains
description: Sites where archaeological remains are discovered, and require conservation

name: Uprn
description: Unique Property Reference Number (UPRN) is the unique identifier for every addressable location in the UK

name: Locally significant industrial sites (lsis)
description: Sites that have particular local importance for industrial and related functions

name: BGS groundwater flooding
description: Areas where groundwater flooding could occur or where groundwater may come close to the ground surface in England, Wales and Scotland

name: Marine conservation zones
description: Marine areas that protect a range of nationally important, rare or threatened habitats and species

name: BGS permeability
description: ‘Permeability’ refers to whether and how water can flow through a rock. This data is often used in studies of groundwater and in particular during investigations of pollution or aquifer contamination

name: GeoScour
description: Information on the likelihood of river scour (when water erodes sediments) occurences

name: Air quality management locations
description: Locations of air quality monitoring sites

name: Public transport accessibility levels (ptal)
description: A detailed and accurate measure of the accessibility of a point to the public transport network, taking into account walk access time and service availability

name: Areas for environmental enhancement
description: Areas where new habitats for wildlife will be created or restored

name: School catchment areas
description: Geographical area surrounding a school from which it will usually take most of its pupils

name: Canals
description: Human-made waterways that allow boats and ships to pass from one body of water to another

name: Coal authority mine water treatment schemes
description: Locations where mine water is treated to improve water quality in polluted rivers

name: Existing railway network
description: The existing railway network.

name: National chargepoint register
description: Database of public electric vehicle chargepoints  in the UK

name: National cycle network
description: The UK-wide network of signed paths and routes for walking, wheeling, and cycling outdoors

name: COMAH – major hazard sites
description: Sites storing or handling large quantities of chemicals or hazardous substances that are covered by the Control of Major Accident Hazards (COMAH) Regulations
synonyms: Control of major accident and hazard sites

name: Local environment record centre boundaries
description: Local Environmental Records Centre (LERC) areas

name: Coastal erosion risk
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://www.gov.uk/guidance/updates-to-national-flood-and-coastal-erosion-risk-information', 'link_text': 'New national flood and coastal erosion risk information'}]

name: Contravention of building notices
description: Notices requiring work that does not comply with building regulations to be pulled down or removed, or for additional work to be carried out to make it comply

name: Doorstep greens
description: New or renovated areas of public open space close to people’s homes that can be enjoyed permanently by the local community

name: Crossrail route
description: Train route linking Reading and Heathrow in the west with Shenfield and Abbey Wood in the east, via tunnels under central London

name: Crossrail stations
description: Stations on the train route linking Reading and Heathrow in the west with Shenfield and Abbey Wood in the east, via tunnels under central London

name: Nhs trusts
description: An organisational unit within the NHS that serves either a geographical area or a specialised function (such as an ambulance service)

name: Landmark buildings
description: Buildings of great historical or artistic value that have protection to prevent them from being changed or destroyed

name: Noise action important areas
description: A framework to manage environmental noise and to protect quiet areas in large urban areas

name: Development consent order boundary
description: The boundary of the nationally significant infrastructure project (NSIP), which has been granted planning consent through the development consent order (DCO) process.

name: Dune slack likely locations
description: Likely locations and boundaries of dune slacks (a depression in the coastal dune system) for sites around England

name: Environmental & pollution notice
description: Notice issuing penalties for environmental crimes

name: Nuclear consultation zone
description: Consultation zones to limit the radiological consequences to members of the public in the event of a radiation emergency

name: Nuclear power stations
description: Power plants that use the process of nuclear fission to generate electricity

name: Planning application consultations
description: The period of consultation where views on the proposed development can be communicated

name: Minerals and waste plan
description: Locations for future minerals extraction (such as sand and gravel pits or crushed rock quarries) and for the development of waste management facilities (such as recycling centres)

name: Coalfield
description: A coal mining area that could contain unrecorded hazards

name: Coalfield consultation area
description: Areas where the Coal Authority recommends a mining search report is required for property conveyancing or development

name: Coastal storm surge flood risk areas
description: A storm surge is a change in sea level that is caused by a storm. They can lead to extensive flooding and are dangerous for people living in many coastal areas.

name: Coastal topographic surveys
description: Surveys covering beaches, dunes, cliffs, saltmarshes and coastal defence structures

name: Conservation convenant
description: A conservation covenant agreement is a private, voluntary agreement to conserve the natural or heritage features of the land. This can include buildings on the land.

name: Gigabit availability coverage
description: The coverage of where wifi download speeds of 1,000mbps (megabits per second) are available.

name: Less favoured areas
description: Remote and constrained rural areas where funding is provided to farming businesses

name: Planning application variance
description: Options for amending proposals that have planning permission

name: Flood risk zones 3
description: An area with a 1% (1 in 100) or greater chance of flooding from rivers, or a 0.5% (1 in 200) or greater chance of flooding from the sea

name: Food hygiene rating
description: Rating that reflects the standards of food hygiene found on the date of the local authority inspection

name: Business improvement districts
description: Business Improvement Districts are business led partnerships which are created through a ballot process to deliver additional services to local businesses.

name: Previously developed land
description: Specifically used by local planning authorities when considering releasing green belt and has very specific requirements and purposes.

name: Food safety notice
description: Notices of serious food safety problems that can include banning certain equipment or processes until improvements have been made

name: Development corporation
description: Statutory bodies set up to regenerate a designated area - once designated, they become the planning authority

name: GeoClimate
description: Maps and data showing potential change in subsidence due to changes in climate

name: Geological disturbance - faults
description: Lines of discontinuity in bedrock where rocks have moved relative to each other

name: Geological disturbance - fissure and breakline
description: Fissures are a crack or opening in rock or the earth created by mining  and breaklines are a vertical step in the rock or earth, created when underground mining has caused differential settlement at the surface

name: Geology 625K
description: Data identifying landscape areas (shown as polygons) attributed with geological names and rock type descriptions

name: GeoSure 5km hex grids
description: Overview of the likelihood of 6 naturally occurring geohazards

name: GeoSure shrink-swell 3D
description: Map identifying areas of potential shrinking and swelling of the ground in 3D in the London and Thames Valley area

name: GeoSure shrink-swell subsurface
description: Map identifying areas of potential shrinking and swelling of the ground that are hidden from the surface underneath other solid formations

name: Police stations
description: The local headquarters of the police

name: Pollinator corridors
description: A corridor of native plants that connects different areas of habitat, providing nutrition and homes for pollinators

name: Ports
description: A maritime facility comprising one or more wharves or loading areas, where ships load and discharge cargo and passengers.

name: GP practices
description: Buildings in which one or more GPs provide general medical services to patients

name: Previously listed buildings
description: Listed buildings that have been de-listed

name: Primary healthcare
description: Primary care services provide the first point of contact in the healthcare system, including GPs, pharmacies, dentists, and optometrists

name: Primary schools
description: Primary education typically cover those aged between 4 and 11.

name: Priority habitat inventory
description: Geographic extent and location of habitats of principal importance

name: Landmark features
description: Easily recognisable features of land that help us work out where we are

name: Houses in multiple occupation
description: A property rented out by at least 3 people who are not from one 'household' (for example a family) but share facilities like the bathroom and kitchen

name: Hospital performance
description: Measures of hospital performance on a national level

name: Hydrogeological maps
description: Maps that bring basic geological information together with data on the hydraulic and hydrochemical characteristics of rocks and their usefulness for groundwater supply

name: Main rivers
description: Designated larger rivers and streams

name: Great crested newt strategic opportunity areas
description: Areas where new ponds would benefit great crested newt (GCN) populations

name: Proposed ramsar sites
description: Proposed boundaries of wetlands of international importance

name: Land ownership boundary
description: The rough boundary of a property

name: Hospitals
description: Building where medical and surgical treatment and nursing care for sick or injured people is provided

name: Locally listed areas
description: To protect locally important historic places and spaces

name: Statement of community involvement (sci)
description: A "Statement of Community Involvement" (SCI) is a document issued by a local council that outlines how they will engage with the community when making planning decisions, explaining the methods they will use to consult residents and other stakeholders during the development of planning policies and when considering individual planning applications.

name: Bgs soil chemistry for environmental assessments
description: Identification of potentially harmful elements (PHEs) that under certain circumstances can be harmful to plants, animals or people

name: Historical mineral planning permissions
description: Boundaries for permitted, withdrawn and refused mineral planning permissions for England and Wales

name: National underground asset register
description: The Geospatial Commission, part of the Department for Science, Innovation and Technology, is building a digital map of underground pipes and cables that will revolutionise the way we install, maintain, operate and repair our buried infrastructure - the National Underground Asset Register (NUAR).
blocked-reason: The NUAR is available via a portal for those involved in 'digging' to refer to. DSIT are keen for 'planning' to be a use case to consider wider applications for the NUAR and are looking at running a discovery in 2025.

name: Millennium greens
description: Areas of green space for the benefit of local communities created to celebrate the millennium

name: MORECS
description: Evaporation and soil moisture deficit for the UK (Meteorological Office rainfall and evaporation calculation system)

name: Multibeam bathymetry
description: High resolution elevation information of underwater terrain

name: Water resource management plan
description: Water Resource Management Plans (WRMPs) set out how water companies intend to achieve a secure supply of water for their customers while protecting and enhancing the environment.

name: Supply-demand balance (water)
description: A "water supply-demand balance" refers to the equilibrium between the amount of available water supply and the amount of water demanded by users, essentially signifying whether there is enough water to meet current needs.

name: National coach services
description: Timetable data for several mainland UK coach services not contained in the Traveline national dataset (TNDS)

name: Integrated care board (icb)
description: Partnerships between the NHS, councils and the voluntary sector to improve health and care services

name: National character areas
description: Geographically unique areas of the UK

name: National flood and coastal erosion risk management strategy
description: Strategy for flooding and coastal change resilience

name: National landslide database
description: Databse of reported landslide events

name: Strategic industrial location (sil)
description: London’s largest concentrations of industrial, logistics and related capacity for uses that support the functioning of London’s economy

name: Possible special areas of conservation
description: Sites on which Government has initiated public consultation on the scientific case for designation as a Special Area of Conservation

name: Greater london archaeological priority areas
description: Areas of Greater London where there is significant known archaeological interest or potential for new discoveries

name: Noise abatement
description: A set of strategies designed to reduce noise pollution

name: Notices, Orders, Directions under Planning Acts
National trust land
description: Land that is enclosed as part of a National Trust estate and public access is limited

name: Probable coal mining
description: Locations and estimated extents of probable shallow coal mines for which no recorded plan exists

name: Protected sites (statutory sites)
description: Sites that have protection through legislation in recognition of biodiversity and geological value
synonyms: Protected land;SAC;SPA;Ramsar;Proposed Ramsar;SSSI;Marine Conservation Area;Local Nature Reserve;Local Wildlife SIte;National Parks and the Broads;AONB;Heritage Coast

name: Public transport timetables
description: Information on timings of all forms of public transport

name: Rainfall data
description: Rainfall measurements across the UK

name: Recorded flood outlines
description: Records of historic flooding from rivers, the sea, groundwater and surface water

name: Regional flood and coastal committees
description: Boundaries of the regional flood and coastal committees in England

name: Renewable energy planning database (REPD)
description: Progress tracking of UK renewable electricity projects over 150kW

name: National trust land – always open
description: National Trust land that the public has access to on foot only

name: Priority river habitat - headwater areas
description: River and stream sources that exhibit a high degree of naturalness

name: Priority river habitat - rivers
description: Rivers and streams that exhibit a high degree of naturalness

name: Retail opportunity areas
description: Appropriate areas for improvement for retail and regeneration

name: Biodiversity net gain assessments
description: A biodiversity net gain assessment compares baseline conditions to post-development plans. Biodiversity net gain is achieved if the post-development plans provide a net improvement to the biodiversity of a site

name: Risk of flooding from rivers and seas – postcodes
description: Postcodes where there is a chance of flooding from rivers and/or the sea

name: Risk of flooding from rivers and seas – properties
description: Properties where there is a chance of flooding from rivers and/or the sea

name: Risk of flooding from surface water
description: Areas where there is risk of flooding from excessive rainfall

name: Infrastructure funding statements
description: A summary of financial contributions councils have secured through section 106 agreements from new developments

name: River corridor features
description: Habitats, flow types and physical features of a watercourse

name: Rocky shores
description: Seacoasts where solid rock predominates

name: Protected land
description: Sites with special status as protected areas because of their natural and cultural importance

name: Section 73
description: Applications for planning permission to develop land without complying with previously imposed planning conditions

name: Secondary schools
description: Secondary education for children from 11 to 16

name: Shallow coal mine workings
description: Shallow coal mine workings are derived from the Coal Authority’s records of underground coal mine workings

name: SOBI (Single Onshore Boreholes Index)
description: Records of boreholes, shafts and wells from all forms of drilling and site investigation work

name: Soil parent material model
description: Characteristics of the upper 2–3 m of the geology beneath our feet

name: Soil type
description: Soil landscapes of England and Wales

name: Religious buildings
description: Structures created for worship

name: Tennis courts
description: Courts or areas with a net across the middle used for playing tennis

name: Uk airport data
description: The presence of passenger and cargo airports in the UK.

name: TOID
description: A unique reference identifier assigned by Ordnance Survey to identify every topographical feature

name: Unitary authority
description: Where county and district councils in ‘two-tier’ areas are replaced with a single tier of ‘unitary’ authorities responsible for all functions of county and district councils

name: Traffic schemes
description: Scheme to reduce motor vehicle traffic in residential streets

name: Transaction data
description: Records of land transactions

name: Traveline national dataset
description: Public transport timetables for bus, light rail, tram and ferry services

name: UK house price data
description: Changes in the value of residential properties

name: Urban development area
description: Comprising residential, growth zones, commercial, industrial, public-use, and mixed-use zones

name: Vertical aerial photography
description: Airborne mapping technique

name: Waterside regeneration zones
description: Regeneration areas to make the most of waterways

name: Weather forecasting
description: A prediction of what the weather will be like in an hour, tomorrow, or further in the future

name: Wellmaster hydrogeological database index
description: Information on water wells and boreholes

name: Flood risk zones 2
description: An area with between 0.1% (1 in 1000) and 1% (1 in 100) chance of flooding from rivers or between 0.1% (1 in 1000) and 0.5% (1 in 200) chance of flooding from the sea
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://ckan.publishing.service.gov.uk/dataset/flood-map-for-planning-rivers-and-sea-flood-zone-2', 'link_text': 'National dataset documentation page'}, {'link_url': 'https://environment.data.gov.uk/arcgis/rest/services/EA/FloodMapForPlanningRiversAndSeaFloodZone2/MapServer/0', 'link_text': 'URL of national dataset'}]

name: Use class
description: Legal framework which determines what a particular property may be used for by its lawful occupants

name: Waste and recycling facilities
description: Specialist locations where waste is taken to be sorted, separated, and recycled

name: Biosphere reserves
description: Areas where local people model how we can live with nature and use its resources sustainably. They are designated by UNESCO (United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organisation)

name: Land required for public purpose
description: Land reserved for a public purpose under a planning scheme

name: National grid cables
description: Locations of national electricity transmission network cables
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://www.nationalgridet.com/network-and-assets/network-route-maps', 'link_text': 'National dataset documentation page'}, {'link_url': 'https://www.nationalgrid.com/electricity-transmission/network-and-infrastructure/network-route-maps', 'link_text': 'National Grid - Network Route Maps website'}]

name: Local nature recovery strategy
description: Locations to create or improve habitat most likely to provide the greatest benefit for nature and the wider environment

name: Area of archaeological importance
description: Areas designated to protect archaeological remains from being damaged or destroyed

name: Broadband speed
description: Coverage of broadband availability

name: Local development order
description: Local development orders (LDOs) provide permitted development rights for specified types of development in defined locations.

name: Area of deficiency in access to public open space
description: Areas over specific walking distance from each of the categories of public open space as set out within the London Plan

name: Border
description: The boundary of England as provided by the ONS for the purposes of producing statistics.

name: Green space
description: Places that are intentionally not developed

name: Biodiversity net gain
description: Biodiversity net gain (BNG) is a strategy to develop land and contribute to the recovery of nature. It's a way of making sure the habitat for wildlife is in a better state than it was before development

name: Coal authority risk area
description: Areas which contain recorded features which could cause risk from the legacy of coal mining operations
synonyms: Development risk and coal resource areas

name: Early years provision
description: Education and childcare provision for children under 5 through nurseries, private, voluntary and independent (PVI) providers, including childminders

name: Gas pipeline
description: Gas pipelines are wide-diameter, long-distance pipelines that transport natural gas from the producing and processing areas to storage facilities and distribution centres

name: Gas pipeline zones
description: Zones which require proper selection and installation of apparatus to be used safely in that environment,because of the properties of the flammable gas present - classified as inner, middle and outer zones

name: Protected species
description: Threatened, vulnerable or endangered species which are protected from extinction

name: Public paths byways
description: Tracks and paths open to the public

name: Area habitats
description: Habitats recorded in the biodiversity metric tool in area (hectares) used to calculate BNG.

name: Land registry polygons / red line boundaries
description: The indicative shapes and positions of each boundary of registered titles for land and property
synonyms: Land ownership boundary;Land Registry Parcels;INSPIRE Index Polygons;Land Registry Cadastral Parcels;Title boundaries;Title extent

name: Non designated and locally listed historic assets
Coastal change management areas
description: Areas identified as likely to be affected by physical change to the shoreline through erosion

name: Safeguarded aerodromes
description: Areas designed to protect aircraft from obstacles when manoeuvring on the ground, taking off, landing or flying in the vicinity of the aerodrome

name: Completion notices
description: Documents that set a date when work on a new building or conversion should be complete

name: Neighbourhood plans
description: A plan prepared by a parish council or neighbourhood forum for a designated neighbourhood area, giving communities direct power to shape the development and growth of their local area

name: Housing and economic land availability assessment (helaa)
Local green space
description: Protected green areas demonstrably special to the local community, whether in a village or in a neighbourhood in a town or city

name: London squares
description: Protected squares in London that should only be used as ornamental gardens, pleasure grounds or for play, rest or recreation

name: Local area requirements
description: Requirements (sometimes known as validation checklists) that set out supporting information which applicants need to include with a planning application

name: Environmental pollution incidents
description: Events that may cause harm or potential harm to an environmental aspect (air, water, land, wildlife or local habitat)

name: Housing waiting list
description: A waiting list of people who qualify for social housing

name: Assets of community value
description: Buildings or pieces of land that are used for the social wellbeing and interests of the local community

name: Compulsory purchase orders
description: Orders that allow a public authority to acquire land without the consent of the owner

name: Land maintenance notice
description:
A notice served when the condition of land is having an
adverse effect on a neighbourhood

name: Opencast coal prospecting areas
description: Areas of opencast coal prospecting sites.

name: National parks and the broads
description: A large area of land protected by law for the benefit of the nation

name: Community infrastructure levy (cil)
description: The Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL) is a charge which can be levied by local authorities on new development. It only applies in areas where a local authority has consulted on and approved a charging schedule which sets out those charges

name: Ancient woodlands
description: Areas that have been wooded continuously since at least 1600 AD
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://data.gov.uk/dataset/9461f463-c363-4309-ae77-fdcd7e9df7d3/ancient-woodland-england', 'link_text': 'National dataset documentation page'}, {'link_url': 'https://opendata.arcgis.com/datasets/a14064ca50e242c4a92d020764a6d9df_0.geojson', 'link_text': 'URL of national dataset'}]

name: Irreplaceable habitats
description: Habitats that could not be recreated if damaged, such as ancient woodland, ancient and veteran trees, blanket bog, limestone pavement, sand dunes, salt marsh and lowland fens

name: Opportunity areas
description: London’s principal opportunities for accommodating large scale development to provide substantial numbers of new employment and housing, each typically more than 5,000 jobs and/or 2,500 homes, with a mixed and intensive use of land and assisted by good public transport accessibility. As set out within the London Plan (2021).

name: Casi and lidar habitat
description: A habitat map derived from airborne data, specifically CASI and LIDAR data. The habitat map is a polygon shapefile showing site relevant habitat classes, for sites where data is available.

name: Important bird areas
description: Areas identified as being globally important for the conservation of bird populations

name: Smoke control area
description:
Areas where:
- you cannot release smoke from a chimney
- you can only burn authorised fuel, unless you use an appliance approved by Defra
blocked-reason: Unclear licensing - needs clarification with Defra / Ordnance Survey

name: 3g/ 4g/ 5g coverage
description: Coverage of mobile phone networks

name: Common land and village greens
description: Areas of open space that have been used for recreation by the inhabitants of the town, village or parish for generations
synonyms: Commons and Village greens;Registered village greens;Town and village greens
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://www.gov.uk/guidance/town-and-village-greens-how-to-register', 'link_text': 'Town and village greens: how to register'}, {'link_url': 'https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/218584/village-green-1993.pdf', 'link_text': '[National dataset] - database of registered town or village greens in England'}]

name: Hazardous substance contravention notice
description: A hazardous substance contravention notice can be issued to a person who does not have the consent to store hazardous substances

name: Safety hazard areas
synonyms: Health and Safety Executive Consultation (HSE) Zones

name: Usrn
description: Unique Street Reference Number (USRN) is an 8 digit unique identifier for every street across Great Britain

name: Protected views
description: Legal requirement to preserve the view of a specific place or historic building from another location

name: Public safety zone around airport
description: End of runway areas where development is restricted for public safety

name: Railway tracks
description: The structures that trains run on

name: Flood risk zone 1
description: An area with a less than 0.1% (1 in 1000) chance of flooding from rivers or the sea

name: Regionally important geological site
description: Regionally important geological sites (RIGS) are the most important designated sites for geology and geomorphology, representing educational, historical and recreational resources. In London, RIGS sites should be protected as set out in Policy G9 of the London Plan

name: Postcodes
description: A series of letters and numbers designated to an address for sorting mail

name: Reservoirs
description: Artificial lakes where water is collected and stored

name: River basin districts
description: Areas of land and sea, made up of one or more neighbouring river basins together with their associated groundwaters and coastal waters

name: Self and custom build area
description: Plots for custom and self-build homes

name: Contaminated land
description:
Land where substances are causing or could cause:

- significant harm to people, property or protected species
- significant pollution of surface waters (for example lakes and rivers) or groundwater
- harm to people as a result of radioactivity

name: National grid substation sites
description: Locations of national electricity transmission substations

name: Metropolitan open land (london)
description: Open space that contributes to the structure of London

name: Environmentally sensitive areas
description: Agricultural areas which need special protection because of its landscape, wildlife or historical value.

name: Ramsar
description: An area of wetlands that is of international importance

name: Safeguarding aerodromes, technical sites and military explosives storage areas
description: Areas which are safeguarded specifically for aerodromes, technical sites and military explosives storage.

name: Transport (under TCPA route)
description: Different types of transport infrastructure including walking and cycling routes, public transport, parking, large scale transport facilities such as ports, airports and interchanges for rail freight

name: National grid towers
description: Structural supports, known as pylons, that carry the UK’s network of high-voltage overhead power lines

name: Country parks
description: Areas of countryside set aside for public recreation

name: National Public Transport Access Nodes (NaPTAN)
description: All public transport access points where you can get on or off public transport
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-public-transport-access-node-schema', 'link_text': 'Guidance on National public transport access nodes'}]

name: Nature improvement areas
description: Areas of the country where partnerships have been set up to enhance the natural environment

name: Control of major accident and hazard sites
description: Sites storing or handling large quantities of chemicals or hazardous substances that are covered by the Control of Major Accident Hazards (COMAH) Regulations

name: Countryside stewardship scheme agreements
description: Previous agreements that provided financial incentives for farmers, foresters and land managers to look after and improve their environments

name: Article 4 Directions
description: An Article 4 direction is made by the local planning authority to remove all or some of the permitted development rights on a site in order to protect it

name: Flood storage areas
description: Areas that act as a balancing reservoir, storage basin or balancing pond for flood control

name: Flood risk zones
description: Areas at risk from flooding from rivers or the sea

name: Housing delivery test
description: Data centrally compiled by MHCLG to assess whether LPAs are meeting their housing targets and needs

name: Cropland
description: Areas of land used for growing crops

name: Designated open space
description: Land laid out as a public garden or used for the purposes of public recreation

name: Seabird nesting counts
description: Counts of breeding seabirds

name: Bowling greens
description: Areas of very smooth, short grass on which the game of bowls or lawn bowling is played

name: Town centre boundaries
description: Location, extent and function of retail areas

name: Drainage agreements and consents
description: Agreements in place to drain buildings in combination into an existing sewer through a private sewer, or consent for a building, or building extension to be built over or near a drain, sewer or disposal main

name: Mineral safeguarding areas
description: Areas where known deposits of minerals are safeguarded

name: Watercourses
description: A natural or artificial channel through which water flows

name: Secondary healthcare
description: Secondary healthcare includes facilities where patients have been referred, such as hospitals, mental health services, community health facilities and sexual health services

name: Local geological site
description: Non-statutory geological sites which are given protection through the planning process, designated by local authorities.

name: Tree preservation orders
description: The order document that protects a tree or group of trees

name: Allotments
description: Land used by communities for growing vegetables, fruit, herbs or flowers which is not for profit

name: Golf courses
description: Large areas of grass specially designed for people to play golf on

name: Sensitive areas - nitrates
description: Areas designated as being at risk from agricultural nitrate pollution

name: Shellfish waters
description: Areas designated for the protection of shellfish growth and production

name: Sites of importance for nature conservation
description: Defined areas identified and selected for their nature conservation value

name: Radon
description: A naturally occurring radioactive gas which may be found in high concentrations in indoor environments
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://www.bgs.ac.uk/datasets/radon-data-indicative-atlas-of-radon/', 'link_text': 'National dataset documentation page'}, {'link_url': 'https://www.bgs.ac.uk/download/radon-potential-indicative-atlas-data-for-great-britain/#', 'link_text': 'URL of national dataset'}, {'link_url': 'https://osdatahub.os.uk/downloads/open/Radon_Indicative_Atlas', 'link_text': 'Radon Indicative Atlas OS open data'}]

name: Social housing
description: Social housing is more affordable than housing on the open market. It can be rented from housing associations or councils at reduced rents, or it can be part-sold, part-rented as shared ownership.

name: Sparsely vegetated land
description: Environments where plants are slow to establish and easily disturbed

name: Locally listed buildings
description: A building recognised by the local authority (but not nationally) as having local importance due to its architectural, historical or environmental significance
synonyms: local heritage assets;local lists;local heritage;local heritage list sites

name: Energy performance certificates
description:
Certificates that contain:

- information about a property’s energy use and typical energy costs
- recommendations about how to reduce energy use and save money
- an energy efficiency rating from A (most efficient) to G (least efficient), valid for 10 years

name: Boundary line
description: Open OS product that maps every administrative boundary in detail for you

name: Environmental outcome reports
description: A system of assessing environmental impacts from development, plans, projects and policies

name: Special educational needs and disabilities (send)
description: Special educational needs and disabilities (SEND) can affect a child or young person’s ability to learn. Mainstream schools must provide access to services and extra support for SEND pupils, and there are also SEND-specific schools

name: Special roadside verges
description: Uncultivated areas of grassland next to roads in an intensively farmed landscape

name: Strategic areas for regeneration
description: These areas are the Census Local Super Output Areas (LSOAs) in greatest socio-economic need. They fall within the 20 per cent most deprived LSOAs in England, using the Index of Multiple Deprivation. As set out within the London Plan (2021).

name: Built up areas
description: Land which is characteristic of a village, town or city

name: Strategic flood risk assessments
description: A Strategic Flood Risk Assessments are undertaken by local planning authorities and inform local flood risk
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://www.gov.uk/guidance/local-planning-authorities-strategic-flood-risk-assessment', 'link_text': 'How to prepare a strategic flood risk assessment'}]

name: Enterprise zone
description: Areas where commercial and industrial businesses can get incentives to set up or expand

name: Essex wildlife trust reserves
description: Nature reserves and discovery centres managed and protected by Essex Wildlife Trust

name: Fast food exclusion zone
description: Zones where fast food outlets are banned because they'd be within 400m of schools and other places where children congregate

name: Fibre to the premises (fttp)
description: Also known as ultrafast full fibre broadband, this involves laying fibre optic cables directly from the broadband exchange into homes, offering speeds of up to 1,000Mb (megabits per second) – around 30 times faster than standard fibre

name: Flood risk area
description: Areas where there is a risk of flooding from rivers or the sea

name: Grassland
description: Landscapes dominated by grasses

name: Great crested newt risk zones
description: Areas where the distribution of great crested newts (GCN) has been categorised into zones

name: Strategic road network
description: 4,500 miles of motorways and major A roads

name: Suitable alternative natural greenspace (sang)
description: SANG provides an alternative greenspace to attract residents of new developments away from the protected and vulnerable sites

name: Supplementary planning document (spd)
description: Detailed advice or guidance on policies in an adopted local plan, and a material consideration in decision-making

name: Traditional orchards
description: Traditional orchards are priority habitats that are groups of fruit and nut trees planted on vigorous rootstocks at low densities in permanent grassland, and managed in a low intensity way

name: Great crested newts edna pond surveys
description: Surveys of ponds to detect newt environmental DNA

name: Groundwater source protection zones
description: Zones that provide additional protection to safeguard drinking water quality

name: Groundwater vulnerability
description: Whether groundwater has a high, medium or low risk of pollution

name: Habitat networks
description: Sets of separate areas of habitat that are close enough together to connect in some way

name: Heathland and shrub
description: Land that has at least 25% cover of woody species such as gorse or heather

name: Heritage action zone
description: Grant-funded projects restoring historic environments

name: Heritage assets of archaeological interest
description: An area that holds, or potentially holds, evidence of past human activity worthy of expert investigation

name: Heritage at risk
description: Hostoric sites that are most at risk of being lost as a result of neglect, decay or inappropriate development

name: Higher education
description: Both undergraduate and postgraduate courses, typically attended in higher education institutions, such as Universities.

name: Historic environment record
description: Details of local archaeological sites and finds, historic buildings and historic landscapes

name: Historic stone quarry
description: Area where quarrying of stone was previously carried out

name: Hs2 safeguarded area
description: Protected land that might be needed to build the HS2 railway

name: Public parks and gardens
description: Accessible, high quality opportunities for informal recreation and community events, including urban parks, country parks, regional parks, forest parks, and formal gardens

name: Employment allocations
description: Sites that have been identified for employment use

name: Educational establishment
description: Educational establishments in the UK including nurseries, primary and secondary schools

name: Play spaces
description: Children's play provision, including local areas for play (LAP), locally equiped areas for play (LEAP), and neighbourhood equipped area of play (NEAP).

name: Local landscape area
description: Areas in Scotland which are given a local designation to sure that the landscape is not damaged by inappropriate development, and to encourage positive landscape management

name: Historic parks and gardens
description: Designed landscapes of special historical interest because of their layout, features and architectural decoration
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://historicengland.org.uk/listing/the-list/data-downloads', 'link_text': 'National dataset documentation page'}, {'link_url': 'https://historicengland.org.uk/content/data-downloads-gis/parks-and-gardens/', 'link_text': 'URL of national dataset'}]

name: Scheduled monuments
description: A site that's legally protected because of its historical importance

name: Protected wreck sites
description: The restricted area around the wreck of a nationally important vessel to prevent any interference

name: Hedgerows
description: Any boundary line of trees or shrubs over 20m long and less than 5m wide

name: Battlefields
description: Areas registered with Historic England as a battlefield of historical significance
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://historicengland.org.uk/listing/the-list/data-downloads', 'link_text': 'National dataset documentation page'}, {'link_url': 'https://historicengland.org.uk/content/data-downloads-gis/battlefields/', 'link_text': 'URL of national dataset'}]

name: Indoor sports and leisure facilities
description: Multi-sports building where a range of sport and recreational activities can take place

name: Safeguarded wharves
description: Wharves in London which have been given special status to ensure they are retained as working wharves and are protected from redevelopment

name: Local planning authority
description: The planning department of the district or borough council

name: Area of deficiency in access to nature
description: Areas over 1km walking distance from Sites of importance for Nature Conservation (SINCs)

name: Cemetery
description: A cemetery provided and maintained by a burial authority

name: Council wards
description: Local areas that have been divided for voting purposes
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://beta.ordnancesurvey.co.uk/products/boundary-line', 'link_text': 'National dataset documentation page'}, {'link_url': 'https://geoportal.statistics.gov.uk/documents/4d9aa61b06a64ec1b7cc4aecbcfbb7a9/about', 'link_text': 'ONS dataset documentation page'}]

name: Designated neighbourhood forums
description: Organisations or groups empowered to lead the neighbourhood planning process in a neighbourhood area where there is no town or parish council

name: Fire and rescue stations
description: Buildings which store firefighting equipment, such as fire engines and hoses, as well as providing working and living spaces for firefighters and support staff

name: National nature reserves
description: Areas where wildlife, plants and animals are protected to allow them to thrive

name: Priority habitats
description: The UK Biodiversity Action Plan (UK BAP) refers to a number of priority habitats, including terrestrial, freshwater and marine habitats. Each priority habitat has a corresponding Habitat Action Plan (HAP)

name: Further education
description: Non-advanced courses taken after the period of compulsory education. Primarily taught to those aged 16 and over in further education colleges, work-based learning, and adult and community learning institutions

name: Agricultural land classification
description: A system that grades the quality of land for agricultural use
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://naturalengland-defra.opendata.arcgis.com/datasets/Defra::provisional-agricultural-land-classification-alc-england/about', 'link_text': 'National dataset documentation page'}, {'link_url': 'https://services.arcgis.com/JJzESW51TqeY9uat/arcgis/rest/services/Provisional Agricultural Land Classification (ALC) (England)/FeatureServer/0/query?outFields=*&where=1%3D1&f=geojson', 'link_text': 'URL of national dataset'}]

name: Drinking water safeguard zone
description: Drinking Water Groundwater Safeguard Zones (SgZs) are established around public water supplies where additional pollution control measures are needed.
synonyms: Drinking Water Groundwater Safeguard Zones (SgZs) are established around public water supplies where additional pollution control measures are needed.

name: Topography
description: Data describing the relief of the land needed to remove steep or inaccessible sites otherwise unsuitable for development.

name: Planning application submissions
description: Working towards a set of data specifications that define what needs to be included when submitting a planning application
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://design.planning.data.gov.uk/advisory-group', 'link_text': 'Advisory group updates'}, {'link_url': 'https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1MfoIIZBU3cSIhk8awT3f8fv7j_AETT7PLslTJaoa_0Y/edit?usp=sharing', 'link_text': 'Module tracker (where is each specification)'}, {'link_url': 'https://github.com/digital-land/planning-application-data-specification', 'link_text': 'Planning application data specification (GitHub)'}]

name: Planning applications & decisions
description: Records of applications for development and the associated decisions
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://www.gov.uk/search-register-planning-decisions', 'link_text': 'Service: Search the register of planning decisions'}]

name: Planning conditions
description: Conditions attached to the granting of planning permission to ensure that the development can take place where otherwise it would have been necessary to refuse planning permission
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://www.gov.uk/guidance/use-of-planning-conditions', 'link_text': 'Planning conditions guidance'}, {'link_url': 'https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVNRvkj-0=/', 'link_text': 'Draft data model board'}, {'link_url': 'https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/5a78f5ba40f0b62b22cbe28a/324923.pdf', 'link_text': 'Use of conditions in planning permission (Circular 11/95)'}, {'link_url': 'https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WjLD8vTEGJXG2jn0UIAnC0xR20pon6XyMdybRtBtlLA/edit?usp=sharing', 'link_text': 'Early research notes'}, {'link_url': 'https://docs.google.com/document/d/1rHFtLB_gsJkukzjlpwrTej7eTDP5sPeNt1ftPxxGy1A/edit?usp=sharing', 'link_text': 'Draft user needs 2023'}, {'link_url': 'https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1vv9Tz92gKgK4llHGpxeO4w29qEGf8xBMxQfFhSbU4F0/edit?usp=sharing', 'link_text': 'Data template and example'}]

name: Air quality management areas
description: Areas where air pollution levels have exceeded the national air quality objectives

name: World heritage sites
description: A natural or man-made site, area, or structure that is protected because of its international importance

name: Public rights of way (prow)
description: Specific routes the public have a legal right to use across land that may be owned by a private individual

name: Existing housing stock
description: To determine the minimum number of homes needed, strategic policies should be informed by a local housing need assessment, conducted using the standard method in national planning practice guidance. The standard method is a calculation informed by existing housing stock and affordability.

name: Central activities zone
description: Central areas of London with implications for planning designated by the Greater London Authority (GLA)
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://www.london.gov.uk/programmes-strategies/planning/implementing-london-plan/london-plan-guidance-and-spgs/central-activities-zone#:~:text=of%20the%20CAZ.-,What%20is%20the%20Central%20Activities%20Zone%3F,its%20shopping%2C%20culture%20and%20heritage.', 'link_text': 'Central Activities Zone'}, {'link_url': 'https://www.london.gov.uk/sites/default/files/caz_spg_final_v4.pdf', 'link_text': 'Supplementary Planning Guidance'}, {'link_url': 'https://www.london.gov.uk/programmes-strategies/planning/london-plan/past-versions-and-alterations-london-plan/london-plan-2004', 'link_text': 'London Plan 2004'}, {'link_url': 'https://www.london.gov.uk/sites/default/files/2022-11/CLFJ9889-Future-actions-221122-WEB_optimised.pdf', 'link_text': 'CAZ Futures Action Plan'}]

name: Flood risk zones 3b
description: Flood risk zone 3b, or the 'functional floodplain' is land where water has to flow or be stored in times of flooding, often to protect downstream communities from flooding.
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://www.gov.uk/guidance/flood-risk-assessment-in-flood-zones-2-and-3', 'link_text': 'Flood risk assessment zones 2 + 3 guidance'}, {'link_url': 'https://www.gov.uk/guidance/flood-risk-and-coastal-change', 'link_text': 'Flood risk guidance'}, {'link_url': 'https://docs.google.com/document/d/1a458xs4QgOG-WDKXyNzz3vPVLcAFh9jobIUn4wcgBTc/edit?usp=sharing', 'link_text': 'Design process document'}]

name: Road classification
description: The system of roads classification that all UK roads (excluding motorways) fall into - A roads, B roads, classified unnumbered, unclassified

name: Neighbourhood development order
description: Communities can grant planning permission through Neighbourhood Development Orders for specific development which complies with the order.

name: Mining and ground stability
description: Potential ground stability hazards from mining activities

name: Certificate of immunity
description: A guarantee that a building or buildings will not be newly listed or given a building preservation notice for the next 5 years

name: Affordability index
description: To determine the minimum number of homes needed, strategic policies should be informed by a local housing need assessment, conducted using the standard method in national planning practice guidance. The standard method is a calculation informed by existing housing stock and affordability.

name: Safeguarded land
description: A planning mechanism to make sure land which has been identified for development in the future is protected from conflicting development

name: Local housing need
description: Housing need is an unconstrained assessment of the minimum number of homes needed in an area. Assessing housing need is the first step in the process of deciding how many homes need to be planned for.

name: Authority monitoring reports (amrs)
description: Local planning authorities must publish information at least annually, monitoring their progress on various planning activities, such as Local Plan preparation, activities relating to the duty to cooperate, indicators in the plan, and policies which are not being implemented.

name: Parliamentary constituencies
description: Specific geographical areas that are represented by each MP in the House of Commons

name: Archaeological notification area (ana)
description: A designated zone where there is known or suspected archaeological interest, requiring additional consideration during the planning process.

name: Supplementary plans
description: Through the LURA, supplementary plans were introduced (as a replacement for 'supplementary planning documents'. Supplementary plans are only able to cover specific topics, must now go through examination, and as such, carry more weight.

name: Local listed building consent orders
description:
Local Listed Building Consent Orders allow a Local Planning Authority (LPA) to grant listed building consent for an extended period for works of any description for the alteration or extension of groups of listed buildings in all or part of their area, or buildings of a particular description in
their area.
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://historicengland.org.uk/images-books/publications/drawing-up-local-listed-building-consent-order-advice-note-6/heag009-listed-building-consent-order-an6/', 'link_text': 'Drawing up a Local Listed Building Consent Order Historic England Advice Note 6'}]

name: Health and safety executive consultation zones
description: The Health and Safety Executive (HSE) sets the consultation zone around major hazard sites and major accident hazard pipelines, after assessing the risks and likely effects of major accidents

name: Nationally significant infrastructure projects (nsip)
description: Major infrastructure projects such as new harbours, roads, power generating stations (including offshore wind farms) and electricity transmission lines, which require a type of consent known as ‘development consent’

name: Special areas of conservation
description: An area containing wildlife or marine life habitats and species that need conservation

name: Local authority district
description: The geographic area that a local government body is responsible for

name: Heritage coast
description: A stretch of undeveloped coast designated for conservation

name: Design codes
description: A Design Code is a set of design requirements providing specific parameters for the physical development of a site or area. They set expectations of design quality for any upcoming development.
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://www.gov.uk/guidance/creating-a-design-code', 'link_text': 'Design code guidance'}, {'link_url': 'https://app.mural.co/t/mhclg2837/m/mhclg2837/1709140526813/9a28b5a76405c33dbb1568a2870a5e6057bf0b91?sender=u254215e050d2f98c69580938', 'link_text': 'Draft data model (living document)'}, {'link_url': 'https://design-code-prototype.planning-data.dev/', 'link_text': 'Design code library proof of concept'}, {'link_url': 'https://www.local.gov.uk/sites/default/files/documents/DLUHC%20PAS%20LURB%20Design%20Code%20presentation.pdf', 'link_text': 'Background on design code policy'}, {'link_url': 'https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1oLuL8rQ3yBz0fzycDZQczLxFZ-PpAKzNaG2swrRPF1E/edit?usp=sharing', 'link_text': 'Design code template spreadsheet'}]

name: Greenbelt
description: An area of open land around a city that cannot be built on

name: Permitted development rights
description: The right to carry out certain building works and changes of use without the need for a full planning application
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/permitted-development-rights-for-householders-technical-guidance', 'link_text': 'Permitted development rights for householders guidance'}, {'link_url': 'https://www.planning.data.gov.uk/dataset/permitted-development-right', 'link_text': 'Permitted development right dataset'}]

name: Special protection areas
description: An area containing bird habitats and species that need conservation

name: Local plans
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://design.planning.data.gov.uk/planning-consideration/development-plans-and-timetables', 'link_text': 'Development plans consideration'}, {'link_url': 'https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QERjoyZ-7oZkhNdxRmUXDVhCfxZj105SGmEaWUX9uYI/edit?usp=sharing', 'link_text': 'Local plan data collection - summary and challenges'}]

name: Listed building outlines
description: The boundary of the area relating to a listed building which is protected because it has special architectural or historic interest
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://docs.google.com/document/d/1BoTm7kmESHZLBNJibuvdVaMsF3odKsKGLXlPnf-8gFY/edit?usp=sharing', 'link_text': 'Design process document'}, {'link_url': 'https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SJBxZ_pKY1BL9aTckboKS6u6nqwZJOk4_buY9SKJ3Xg/edit', 'link_text': 'Data dependency document'}, {'link_url': 'https://historicengland.org.uk/listing/apply-for-listing/listing-process/', 'link_text': 'The listing process (Historic England)'}, {'link_url': 'https://app.mural.co/t/mhclg2837/m/mhclg2837/1712065005247/3ff6509868c8d96c9665debd82d8f6c1ef627897?sender=u1cae178c0a712eade24c2472', 'link_text': 'Listed buildings process map'}]

name: Housing numbers
description: Number of new homes the government aims to build per year
blocked-reason: Housing numbers covers a lot of different considerations, all related to housing need, targets and delivery. We have, therefore, spit this into separate considerations to investigate. More details in the notes.

name: Gypsy, roma & traveller sites
description: An area of land where gypsy, Roma and traveller communities live which may be owned and managed privately or by the council
blocked-reason: Waiting for engagement on the [draft data model](https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVNIiMA2Y=/?share_link_id=116913957286).

name: Local nature reserves
description: A protected area of land designated by a local authority because of its special natural interest or educational value
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://naturalengland-defra.opendata.arcgis.com/datasets/Defra::local-nature-reserves-england/about', 'link_text': 'National dataset documentation page'}, {'link_url': 'https://services.arcgis.com/JJzESW51TqeY9uat/arcgis/rest/services/Local_Nature_Reserves_England/FeatureServer/0/query?outFields=*&where=1%3D1&f=geojson', 'link_text': 'URL of national dataset'}, {'link_url': 'https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ZObCVL1dGKVEgputfdwPs-Ih43UH5Mradk4zvteeA_Y/edit#heading=h.lb9do641w06g', 'link_text': 'Fact sheet url'}]

name: Potential special protection areas
description: Sites on which Government has initiated public consultation on the scientific case for designation as a Special Protection Area

name: Areas of outstanding natural beauty
description: Land protected by law to conserve and enhance its natural beauty
synonyms: Protected sites; AONB; National Landscape;Areas of outstanding natural beauty
useful-links: [{'link_url': 'https://naturalengland-defra.opendata.arcgis.com/datasets/areas-of-outstanding-natural-beauty-england', 'link_text': 'National dataset documentation page'}, {'link_url': 'https://opendata.arcgis.com/datasets/6f2ad07d91304ad79cdecd52489d5046_0.geojson', 'link_text': 'URL of national dataset'}]

name: Building preservation notices
description: A notice to stop un-listed buildings of special architectural or historic interest from being demolished or altered in a way that affects the character of the building

name: Open space, sports and recreation facilities, public rights of way and local green space
description: Open space, sports and recreation facilities, public rights of way, and local green space in planning - These interconnected elements support community well-being by enabling access to nature, encouraging active lifestyles, and protecting valued green areas through structured and informal use.
